organizations: Citibank Dies Former Face of Citibank
title: Former Face of Citibank Dies
text:
Former Face of Citibank Dies By christina.rexrode@wsj.com July 18, 2015 
Hans Angermueller, who was once in the running to head Citibank and helped draft a deal that freed the American hostages held in Iran, died a week ago at age 90, his family said. 
Mr. Angermueller was the bankâ€™s face to Washington for years, lobbying the government to give a freer rein to an industry still technically forbidden from banking across state lines. He was recruited to Citibank by Chief Executive Walter Wriston in the early... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
